result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Rudolph Forester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
-Court set restitution at 0.
Defendant is advised he may not possess any firearms.

No illegal drugs.
No contact with victim D.J.K.

Complete Batterers Intervention class.
Mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
AODA assessment and cooperte with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent.  Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Timothy Rudolph Forester not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentecing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 8-11-22 at 2:30 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Timothy Rudolph Forester not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court will be down on 5/19/2022 and is unable to hear this case.  ADA Maule and attorney Plummer emailed of new court dates.  Next court date is 5/24/2022 at 1:30 pm for Pretrial Conference by zoom.

Court ordered no contact with D.J.K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Timothy Rudolph Forester in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Timothy Rudolph Forester in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy Rudolph Forester appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
